CatDescriptText: Rosemarie Farrell, housewife,  Pittsburgh and Mike Eshios, businessman, Oakland, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mrs. Farrell's answer reads: "Yes, I think we should have some sort of amusement here in Pennsylvania."  Mr. Eshios' answer reads: "Yes, because I believe that it will ease the tax issue."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Rosemarie Farrell wearing light colored sleeveless top, dark belt, and striped herringbone skirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mike Sehios wearing diagonally striped necktie and herringbone suit jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
